summary: Bile duct cancer, also known as cholangiocarcinoma, is a type of cancer that forms in the bile ducts. The bile ducts are small tubes that carry bile from the liver and gallbladder to the small intestine.
causes: Certain inherited conditions (e.g., Lynch syndrome, cystic fibrosis)
risk_factors: Chronic inflammation of the bile ducts
symptoms: Jaundice (yellowing of the skin and eyes)
diagnosis: Imaging tests (e.g., ultrasound, CT scan, MRI, ERCP)
